map
  • Functions Index
  • Turorials
  • Apps
    • Map tree tags for fieldwork
  • news

A theme that is customized for map_tag().

Theme customized for map_tag(). You can further customize the theme by passing more arguments to ggplot2::theme() (via ...) or by replacing this theme completely with a new ggplot2::theme().

get_theme(panel_grid_major_colour = "black",
  panel_grid_minor_colour = "black", panel_grid_minor_linetype = "dotted",
  panel_background_fill = "white", plot_title_size = 20,
  plot_subtitle_size = 12, legend_position = "top",
  axis_ticks = element_blank(), axis_text_size = 12,
  legend_title = element_blank(), ...)

Arguments

panel_grid_major_colour

Colour of major grid lines.
panel_grid_minor_colour, panel_grid_minor_linetype

Colour and line type of minor grid lines.
panel_background_fill

Fill colour of the background of plotting area, drawn underneath plot.
plot_title_size, plot_subtitle_size

Size of the plot title and subtitle.
legend_position

The position of legends ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top", or two-element numeric vector).
axis_ticks

Tick marks along axes.
axis_text_size

Size of tick labels along axes.
legend_title

title of legend.
...

Other arguments passed to ggplot2::theme().

Value

A ggplot2::theme() customized for map_tag().

See also

ggplot2::theme().

Other functions to fine tune a plot of repulsive tags.: get_header, pad

Examples

ggplot2::theme()
#>  Named list()
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "theme" "gg"
#>  - attr(*, "complete")= logi FALSE
#>  - attr(*, "validate")= logi TRUE
